page.text: "Sure, if you like. But only if you keep buying." says Desharr thoughtfully and then smiles "So what can I get ya?"

page.text: "Sure, we ain't a restuarant. But we get all sorts, and it pays to be able to whip up a plate. 450 credits. you down?"

page.text: Desharr takes your money and goes to the back to yell at someone, within a short time a plate of food is brought out and she plonks it down in front of you. Strange meats and ersatz vegetables are nevertheless tastey and filling when cooked and smothered in flavoursome sauces. Soon enough you've demolished the entirety of the plate.

page.text: "Only for the deserving" says Desharr and turns her back for a few seconds as she mixes the drink then backs around "drink up" she says planting the glass down in front of you. The mixture is zesty and tingles going down. It makes you feel all warm and fuzzy like you're floating on a cloud. page.text: "Best thing to happen to the station. Used to be a lot rougher, then we get a brigade of bunnies in a damaged warship and commander Frei. Word is they turned renegade from some space warlord. Point is they cleared this place up, keep the peace and I only need to keep ONE shotgun under this counter. Fair trade for the deck fees all told."

choice.text: $What do you know about the lizard in the labcoat?
$What do you know about the catgirl store owner?
$What do you know about the wardens?
$What do you know about the catgirl store owner?

page.text: "She's not like the other Valk if that's what you're wondering. The rest of her species are vat grown clone soldiers genetically engineered by, someone. They ain't around no more to ask, either they're extinct, the plague got'em or they're in hiding. Point is, your average Valk is bad news. But Jehari ain't average, she can't hurt anyone. The worst she'll do is ramble on a bit. Frei gives her a discount on deck fees out of the kindness of her heart, I'm not gonna grumble though..be the highest cruelty to turf her out onto the lower decks, she'd not make it a week down there."

choice.text: $What do you know about the wardens?
$What do you know about the catgirl store owner?
$What do you know about the wardens?
$What do you know about the lizard in the labcoat?

page.text: "She says she's a respectable businesswoman now. But lets not beat around the bush, few years back she was a pirate. Not sure how good she was, but she ain't titfat so she must not'a been terrible at it. Rumour is she might have sisters who haven't given up the pirate lifestyle. I wouldn't know, if anyone's run into them out in the black they haven't shown up here to tell their tales. Anyway, keep an eye on her. I ain't sure she's all the way on the level no matter what she says."

page.text: "Me? Not much to tell. my name is Desharr, I own this here establishment hence my name on the banner. And I've owned it since I inherited it from my mam. I ain't one for going a'roaming the stars. Not to say I don't got a few tales, this station used to be a lot rougher. But this ain't the time for those"

page.text: "Come to the right place, but you knew that." she says with a soft smile "Solace is 200 credits. Soulkicker is 500 if you want something stronger"
"Right you are." Desharr fills the mug and passes it to you. Tastes frothy but nice and zesty and not too strong, just helps you get buzzed and relaxed as you take your fill of it.

"Coming up." she says and plants the shotglass down, pouring out a measure from a bottle she produces from under the counter as if by measure. She nudges it towards you. Desharr smiles benignly as you knock back the fiery mixture, it tastes like the end of sobriety crossed with being hit by a comet.
